intro: Astragalus chamaeleuce var. cicadae, commonly known as the cicada astragalus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments, often found in mountainous areas with poor soil. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
